works.title: Repeated explorations of violent scripts: psychotherapy for men acting violently against their female partner
abstract: The effects of psychotherapy for men perpetrating violence toward their female partners have been found to be modest or equivocal; therefore, further research is necessary to determine how therapists can intervene to help clients stop acting violently. To obtain a better understanding of successful therapist strategies in a particular case, we cond...

works.title: Allianser. Verdier, metoder og teori i behandlings- og miljøorientert arbeid med barn, unge og deres familie
abstract: Norwegian textbook on social work with children, young persons and adults in institutions and residential care units.

works.title: Changes in Violence and Clinical Distress Among Men in Individual Psychotherapy for Violence Against Their Female Partner: An Explorative Study
abstract: Most interventions for men who have acted violently toward their partner have been conducted as group interventions within a criminal justice context. Therefore, few studies have examined individual psychotherapy and how such interventions may reduce partner violence. In this study, we aimed to describe changes in violence, and changes in clinical...

works.title: Finding a Common Ground: Therapist Responsiveness to Male Clients Who Have Acted Violently Against Their Female Partner
abstract: Men in treatment for intimate partner violence (IPV) do often present with problem formulations that do not fit the therapeutic endeavor of personal change and may, therefore, challenge therapists in their effort to build an alliance. However, the therapist’s initial contributions are also likely to influence whether the client finds it worthwhile...

works.title: Braving the Elements: Ambivalence as Opportunities for Change in Individual Psychotherapy With Men Using Intimate Partner Violence
abstract: This study examines client utterances that can be understood as ambivalent in violence-focused therapy. The purpose is to enrich our scientific understanding of client contributions to therapy when they appear ambivalent to the therapeutic project and develop clinically relevant perspectives that enable us to help this and other client groups. Usin...

works.title: Mediation strategies in the face of custody conflicts
abstract: Systematic analyses of initiatives and responses from mediators working with parents in intense conflicts about child custody and care brought forward variations in effective strategies. The findings are presented along six dimensions: The topics that were addressed, how the agenda for the sessions was decided, focus on agreement vs relational topi...

works.title: High-conflict parents in mediation: An analysis of dialogues and sources to conflict
abstract: A significant proportion of parents in mediation present destructive and escalating conflicts. In a naturalistic study of sessions with high-conflict couples, we observed dialogues with frequent interruptions, rapidly shifting subjects, and emotional attacks. A systematic search revealed eight distinct sources of conflict that interfered with the m...

works.title: Forskningen på obligatorisk mekling ved samlivsbrudd: et fremoverrettet tilbakeblikk
From Resistance to Invitations: How Men Voluntarily in Therapy for Intimate Partner Violence May Contribute to the Development of a Working Alliance
abstract: The high drop-out rate and modest outcome for men in treatment for intimate partner violence (IPV) have highlighted the question of how therapists can establish an effective working alliance with these clients. The aim of this study was to conceptualize the variety of ways in which male clients using violence against a female partner might present...

works.title: Intimate partner violence in men voluntarily attending treatment: A study of couple agreement
abstract: Most studies examining couple agreement on intimate partner violence (IPV) have found low agreement on levels of violence. This study explored agreement on male-perpetrated IPV in a sample of 93 couples where the man was voluntarily seeking IPV treatment. Five different types of violence were assessed: physical, physically controlling, psychologica...

works.title: Why and how should family therapists take part in family therapy research?
Intimate Partner Violence in Men Voluntarily Attending Treatment: A Study of Couple Agreement
abstract: Most studies examining couple agreement on intimate partner violence (IPV) have found low agreement on levels of violence. This study explored agreement on male-perpetrated IPV in a sample of 93 couples where the man was voluntarily seeking IPV treatment. Five different types of violence were assessed: physical, physically controlling, psychologica...

works.title: Mandatory Mediation outside the Court: A Process and Effect Study
abstract: In a study of 154 couples in precourt mandatory mediation in Norway, a majority of the thirty-eight high-conflict (HC) cases left the mediation after two sessions and without any agreements. Eighteen months later, five of ten HC couples were still without an agreement. With seven sessions available free of charge, the mediation system seems to fail...

works.title: «De har litt sånn bob-bob-stemme». En studie av «In My Shoes» brukt i barnesamtaler ved Skilsmissekonflikter.
abstract: English: The article is based on a study of how the computer-assisted interview In My Shoes (IMS) is used in conversations with children who are experiencing parental conflict following divorce. Transcriptions of video-recordings from these conversations underwent qualitative analysis. These analyses focused on how the children responded during the...

works.title: 75. Egaas Bøhren, I., Stabrun, R. & Tjersland, O. A. (2014). «De har litt sånn bob-bob-stemme». En studie av «In My Shoes» brukt i barnesamtaler ved skilsmissekonflikter. («Their voices sound so queer». A study of dialogues with children living in divorce conflicts, when the computer program «In My Shoes» is used as a helping device). Fokus på Familien, 42(4), 272-294.
abstract:
The article is based on a study of how the computer-assisted interview In My Shoes
(IMS) is used in conversations with children who are experiencing parental conflict following
divorce. Transcriptions of video-recordings from these conversations underwent
qualitative analysis. These analyses focused on how the children responded during the
conversa...

works.title: Kjøs, P., Tjersland, O.A. & Roen, K. (2014). The Mediation Window: Regulation of Argumentation and Affect in Custody Mediation, Journal of Divorce & Remarriage, 55 (7), 527-538
abstract:
High-conflict custody mediation requires working with both the
emotional and the factual aspects of the conflict, while balancing
unequal power relations between parents. Applying conversation
analysis methods to a case of “treatment as usual” high-conflict
mediation, this study offers an analysis of the process of establishing
a balance point—the...

works.title: Fra univers til multiverser – og tilbake igjen
A process study of group therapy with children who have been exposed to violence in their family
Tjersland, O.A., Østvold Lindheim, M. & Gudmudson, P.G. (2012). A process study of group therapy with children who have been exposed to violence in their family. Fokus på Familien 1, 6–26.
abstract:
The article is based on a qualitative analysis of video recordings taken during group
therapy for children who had been exposed to domestic violence. The focus is on how
the children communicated traumatic experiences in a group therapy context, what
stimulated them to share their feelings with others and how they reacted to different
therapeutic i...

works.title: Veiledning i psykoterapeutisk arbeid (Supervision in psychotherapeutic work)
What Constitutes a Good Working Alliance in Therapy with Children That May Have Been Sexually Abused?
abstract: The use of qualitative methods in a case by case study of fifteen psychotherapies with children allowed for inquiries into how the working alliance can be established when children are involved. Therapy hours were recorded, and the children’s, their caregivers’ and the therapists’ views about what happened during therapy were collected at the end o...

works.title: Å gå til psykolog
abstract: Professions

works.title: Det kliniske intervjuet, bind I (The clinical interview; volume I)
From Betrayal to Support: A Case History of Incest
abstract: Relational and systemic ideas about the treatment of sexual abuse within families are presented, followed by a case analysis of the therapeutic process with a young girl and the collaboration with her mother. Central elements in the therapeutic process are discussed related to the individual work with the child, the use of a reflecting colleague, a...

works.title: Evaluation of mediation and parental cooperation based on observations and interviews with the clients of a mediation project
abstract: The article presents findings from a qualitatively oriented mediation project conducted in Oslo, Norway. Information about the mediation and about cooperation between parents is based on interviews with clients and mediators and on observations from every mediation session. The discussion of the results focuses on what can contribute to a successfu...

works.title: Helping families when child sexual abuse is suspected but not proven
abstract: This paper reports from a project investigating reactions within families when intra-familial child sexual abuse was suspected, and family members’ responses to a therapeutic approach. Data were obtained from therapeutic sessions and follow-up interviews with mothers, children and alleged perpetrators. Before treatment the mothers felt uncertain as...

works.title: Reporting possible sexual abuse: A qualitative study on children's perspectives and the context for disclosure
abstract:
The present study investigated the context in which children were able to report their child sexual abuse experiences and the children's views as to what made it difficult to talk about abuse and what helped them in the disclosing process. The aim was to study disclosures as they were occurring in their natural settings.
Data were obtained from the...

works.title: Children's narratives of sexual abuse: What characterizes them and how do they contribute to meaning-making?
abstract: Personal narratives from ten children who all claimed to have been sexually abused were analyzed and compared to narratives of stressful events the children produced in therapy sessions. The narratives were compared to each other along the following dimensions: level of elaboration, narrative structure, contextual embeddedness, and causal coherence...

works.title: From the System of Sexual Abuse to the System of Suspicion
abstract: Compared to 30 years ago, people in Western society have, today, a height-ened sensitivity about sexual abuse of children. Although suspicions of such abuse are more easily aroused now, the task of finding conclusive evidence is still virtually impossible, and a strong focus on the legal aspects of abuse tends to take precedence over therapeutic ne...

works.title: Barn i en relasjonsorientert tilnærming til seksuelle overgrep i familien
Strategies in Mediation Explored and Developed during a Research Project
abstract: This article presents strategies in mediation based on experiences from a mediation project conducted in Oslo, Norway. The mediators integrate knowledge from the mediation tradition and the family therapy tradition. The author describes several motivating, structuring, confirming, and meaning-expanding strategies in the sessions, and how clients ar...

works.title: Extended Mediation in Norway
abstract: The article describes a mediation project in Norway, carried out over several years and finished in 1992. The mediators were therapists belonging to the systemic family therapy tradition. After a brief summary of the legal background for divorce in Norway, the author examines fundamental values in mediation and then presents a detailed description...

works.title: From universe to multiverses--and back again
abstract: A number of concepts and ideas from constructivist and second-order cybernetic family therapy literature are presented and their implications for therapy are examined. I was inspired by and, in this article, refer to videotapes of consultations and therapy sessions shown at an international conference on constructivism and family therapy in Sulitje...

works.title: From Universe to Multiverse — and Back Again
abstract: A number of concepts and ideas from constructivist and second-order cybernetic family therapy literature are presented and their implications for therapy are examined. I was inspired by and, in this article, refer to videotapes of consultations and therapy sessions shown at an international conference on constructivism and family therapy in Sulitje...

works.title: Atferdsterapi i Familier

rg.bio: Odd Arne Tjersland currently works at the Department of Psychology, University of Oslo. Odd does research in Clinical Psychology, Health Psychology and Developmental Psychology. Their most recent publication is 'High-conflict parents in mediation: An analysis of dialogues and sources to conflict'.
